tweets.text:
Rivers are just like the tube network for migratory fish and their path is often blocked by locks or weirs. The Roadmap project focuses on mapping these to provide a blueprint for strategic steps to improve connectivity.
@EnvAgency @LondonNPC @theriverstrust @fishmigration https://t.co/iHFVswBOIo

Looking forward to seeing fish spawning on the riffle "uncovered" by this weir removal!  #freeflowingrivers are key to our #river and fish health.  This work has seen a SSSI unit able to move to favourable condition thanks to support from @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency & @NENorthWest https://t.co/Ay5OmlTvry

Look who was found in the #Thames recently! Historically a common sight, the migratory Twaite shad is now rare and it was great to see it near Blackfriars in Central London! #WorldFishMigrationDay #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek #TidewayLondon https://t.co/MjBH1APVkg

The new wetland @CroxtethHall has already attracted some new wildlife! Can‚Äôt wait to see/hear what‚Äôs living there in a years time once it has greened up üòä @EnvAgencyNW @SimonBennettEA @ccnw1 https://t.co/3rRyGITqTt

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

tweets.text:
On #WorldFishMigrationDay we're thrilled to present a film of the recent Bevere #FishPass Opening #JourneyUpTheSevern #StepUpForFish 
Partners: @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland Funders: @HeritageFundUK @LIFEprogramme #JourneyUpTheSevern #RiverSevern https://t.co/GVr3YwgOjp

The #SLWP Beddington Incinerator üè≠ continues to breach the @EnvAgency permit. 

üì∞Report just published shows: On 4th Oct that the CO Carbon Monoxide went over the permitted limit with a reading as high as 4161mg/m3!

Turning it off for the rest of day went over daily average. https://t.co/1PeRqFxpuE

The team from @WoodlandTrust @CommForestTrust @EnvAgencyNW presented about the living log jams #NaturalFloodManagement trials on Smithills Estate at the #GMGreenSummit2020 recently

If you missed it, not a problem! 

You can watch it here ‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/9xXKAChROW via @YouTube

üì∑https://t.co/ORm20eBUo2 #StepUpForFish https://t.co/RDMqX6T92x

Deeply appreciate if you would watch their video and encourage with RT https://t.co/wVcDuU29Ms

tweets.text:
Our Lincolnshire beach management project is now at the next stage. 

We are testing the condition of the concrete seawall from Mablethorpe to Skegness.

This will reveal the life span of the sea defences and if improvement work is needed. #Lincolnshire #Beach https://t.co/5gIWiu8xUa

@GDMThomas @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @ZacGoldsmith @pow_rebecca Train not prosecute. The EA spend fortunes on greedy barristers ripping into litigant in persons. 
The option ,and better way is farmers to be mandatory trained ala speed awareness course. Only then should legal action be considered.  This will require innovation and initiatives.

#biodiversity #habitat

urls.title: Farmers to be stripped of subsidies for polluting in post-Brexit scheme
urls.description: Farmers will be stripped of subsidies if they pollute rivers under government plans to link payments to water quality. Figures obtained by The Times show that farms are causing a rising number of

tweets.text:
"@EnvAgency has cut farm inspections in England by 2/3 since 2014-15 & is failing to enforce rules introduced in 2018 to stop farmers contaminating rivers with slurry & fertiliser."

Unregulated intensive farming ruins our rivers

#WorldFishMigrationDay https://t.co/xIutXOhH99

We planned #electrofishing monitoring of Bradford Beck #fishpassage easements as part of #WorldFishMigrationDay events but had to run it earlier in the year. The first results are in #WTTBlog https://t.co/IZEnqKuX0D
@WildTroutTrust @BradfordsBecks @EnvAgencyYNE  @fishmigration https://t.co/saaDZna2N2

Today, to celebrate #WorldFishMigrationDay we are delighted to release this short film showcasing the project‚Äôs first weir removal!

Watch the full film hereüêühttps://t.co/XatLeAsulq 

#LIFEDeeRiver @NatResWales @EnvAgencyNW @visitsnowdonia @DwrCymru @LIFEprogramme @fishmigration
@EnvAgencyNW helped fund this too! @ollyolly092 @DamRemoval @lakedistrictnpa please share for #WorldFishMigrationDay https://t.co/3rTtyl9jtr

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
Our scientists have made a breakthrough in supporting the UK‚Äôs response to #coronavirus.

We can now use sewage samples provided by water companies to detect local outbreaks, even when people don‚Äôt show symptoms.

Read more: https://t.co/VlvDhIA8I9

#CovidSewageTesting #TeamEA https://t.co/rhsdlZLGYE

tweets.text: No warning signs are present at the Attenuation ponds #ffn #M6Major #haydock site. How do we know this water is safe & has been tested? Please advise. @StHelensEnviro @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW @sthelenscouncil https://t.co/7me9lJZMIa
@EnvAgencySE @vaselby Is it dead?

Making the impassable, passable - part 2! Upgraded culvert allowing fish passage to 500m of upstream spawning habitat, while maintaining farm access. üêü Part of a major #WEG natural flood management project in the Glenderamackin catchment. #WorldFishMigrationDay @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/SONHz3l37k

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @ZacGoldsmith @pow_rebecca From the article ‚ÄúThe agency has recorded 137 breaches of farming rules on water quality but has brought no prosecutions‚Äù. How is this even possible? They tell us they don‚Äôt have sufficient resources, but why isn‚Äôt every single one of these prosecuted?

tweets.text:
Happy #WorldFishMigrationDayüêü
Last year @GroundworkGM along with the @EnvAgency and other @natural_course key partners, led the removal of a weir on Eagley Brook in Bolton, opening up 2 kilometres of the brook to fish, including Brown Trout.
https://t.co/0Qc7o3w7C3

Support and enjoy #WorldFishMigrationDay When we see our fish migration numbers improving we will know that we have turned a corner for all biodiversity. Alas, numbers and trends are still negative. It's in our hands to turn this tanker around.

Join us TOMORROW on a journey up the Severn for #WorldFishMigrationDay! With video from key locations along the #RiverSevern at these timesüëávia Facebook: https://t.co/HZMEGk6Gro
**Please share!** @severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @HeritageFundM_E @EnvAgencyMids @LIFEprogramme https://t.co/30qfepsAty

tweets.text: We're celebrating #worldfishmigrationday with some pics of the fish passes we've built to help fish on their journey upstream to lay their eggs. Here's #ShotleyBridge fish pass @EnvAgencyYNE Durham County Council  #RiverDerwent https://t.co/LD0d8S2EDj https://t.co/sxNUgoxeO4

@cpvolgroup @CroxtethHall @MerseyRivers @NMBiodiversity @Lancswildlife @WoodlandTrust @merseyforest @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 We‚Äôve had a few visits from a grey wagtail in our school grounds too. Never seen one there before but I‚Äôve spotted it twice in the last few weeks.

Today is #WorldFishMigrationDay üåçüêü We want to show our support for those plucky migratory fish and the people helping conserve our rivers! #StepUpForFish #FishMigration #RiverSevern #FollowTheShad @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland https://t.co/qrBTNiMfm7
